titleStmt.title: They that have any friends distracted or melancholy are desired to accept this: and, they that have none, not to reject it but rather to lay it by them, that they may, when they hear of any that are so, inform their friends; who also may be desirous to hear of one that is faithful and expert in these distempers;...
titleStmt.author: Newton, James, fl. 1675.

titleStmt.title: They that have any friends distracted or melancholy are desired to accept this: and, they that have none, not to reject it but rather to lay it by them, that they may, when they hear of any that are so, inform their friends; who also may be desirous to hear of one that is faithful and expert in these distempers;...
titleStmt.author: Newton, James, fl. 1675.

notesStmt.note: Imperfect: torn at foot and closely cropped with some loss of text.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
